selfEnrollRequest.title: FABRIC Self Signup
selfEnrollRequest.content:
Dear Experimenter,

Welcome to FABRIC. We noticed you are not yet registered with FABRIC. In order for you to begin using FABRIC you must go through a 3-step guided enrollment workflow. Clicking the Signup button below will take you to the first step of this process.

If you have already started the enrollment process and are waiting for the approval, please continue to check your email for an approval message. We aim to process enrollment requests within one business day. You will be able to login after receiving this approval.

Please note: you will always use your institutional credentials to login to FABRIC portal via your institution's Identity Provider - we do not and will never store your password or login information. Any password changes that you go through with your institutional account will also affect how you login to the FABRIC portal.

helperText.projectLeadDescription: Project Lead can create new projects, designate Project Owner(s)  and invite regular members into a project. Faculty or senior staff at universities can request this role.
helperText.facilityOperatorDescription: Facility Operator is a 'superuser' allowed to manipulate any project. This role is reserved for FABRIC staff.
helperText.componentDescription: Component: Hardware that may be added to a virtual machine to expand its capabilities
helperText.networkServiceDescription: Network Service: Virtualized hardware that links nodes in a topology so that information (e.g., packets) can be passed through the network.
helperText.sitesDescription: Sites: Approximately 30 physical locations where FABRIC hardware exists.
helperText.nodeDescription: Node: An individual element (e.g., virtual machine) in a topology that is connected to other nodes to represent the physical and logical structure of a network.
helperText.preferredEmailDescription: Please choose your preferred contact email among the addresses given to us by your Identity Provider.
helperText.privacyPreferencesDescription: Please check the information you want to be available to other FABRIC users.
helperText.publicProjectDescription: Public projects are visible to all FABRIC users while private projects are only visible to project members and facility operators.
helperText.bootScriptDescription: Boot Script (also called 'User Data Scripts') is used to customize the VM after it's provisioned.
